intro: Senecio venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio venezuelensis is often found in open areas such as grasslands and scrublands.
